Parameters: byte: ASN.1 DER encoded wrapped key
String: identifies the private key that can unwrap the wrapped key
String: used to unwrap the key. ex: "RSA/ECB/OAEPPadding"
AlgorithmParameterSpec: spec for the private key used to unwrap the wrapped key
WrappedKeyEntry(byte[],java.lang.String,.Description: Constructs a @B_android#security#keystore#WrappedKeyEntry_E@ with a binary wrapped key.
WrappedKeyEntry(byte[],java.lang.String,.FullName: public WrappedKeyEntry (byte[] wrappedKeyBytes, String wrappingKeyAlias, String transformation, AlgorithmParameterSpec algorithmParameterSpec)

ClassDesc: An @B_java#security#KeyStore#Entry_E@ that holds a wrapped key. Wrapped keys contain encrypted key data and description information that can be used to securely import key material into a hardware-backed Keystore. The wrapped key is in DER-encoded ASN.1 format, specified by the following schema: keyFormat is an integer from the KeyFormat enum, defining the format of the plaintext key material. keyParams is the characteristics of the key to be imported (as with generateKey or importKey). If the secure import is successful, these characteristics must be associated with the key exactly as if the key material had been insecurely imported with importKey. See encryptedTransportKey is a 256-bit AES key, XORed with a masking key and then encrypted in RSA-OAEP mode (SHA-256 digest, SHA-1 MGF1 digest) with the wrapping key specified by wrappingKeyBlob. keyDescription is a KeyDescription, above. encryptedKey is the key material of the key to be imported, in format keyFormat, and encrypted with encryptedEphemeralKey in AES-GCM mode, with the DER-encoded representation of keyDescription provided as additional authenticated data. tag is the tag produced by the AES-GCM encryption of encryptedKey. Imported wrapped keys will have KeymasterDefs.KM_ORIGIN_SECURELY_IMPORTED
